description: A project entity contains information about the overall project.
title: Project
name: project

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

schema_type.description: The type of the metadata schema entity.

provenance.description: Provenance information added or generated at time of ingest.
provenance.title: Provenance
provenance.name: provenance

submission_date.description: When project was first submitted to database.

submitter_id.description: ID of individual who first submitted project.

updater_id.description: ID of individual who last updated project.

document_id.comment: This structure supports the current ingest API. It may change in the future.

accession.description: A unique accession for this entity, provided by the broker.

project_short_name.description: A short name for the project.
project_short_name.guidelines: Project label is a short label by which you refer to the project, should have no spaces, and should be fewer than 50 characters.

project_title.description: An official title for the project.
project_title.example: Study of single cells in the human body..
project_title.guidelines: Project title should be fewer than 30 words such as a title of a grant proposal or a publication.

project_description.description: A longer description of the project which includes research goals and experimental approach.
project_description.guidelines: Project description should be fewer than 300 words such as an abstract from a grant application or publication.

contributors.description: People contributing to any aspect of the project.

items.description: Information about an individual who submitted or contributed to a project.
items.title: Contact
items.name: contact

contact_name.description: Name of individual who has contributed to the project.
contact_name.guidelines: Enter in the format: first name,middle name or initial,last name.

phone.description: Phone number of the individual or their lab.

institution.description: Name of primary institute where the individual works.

laboratory.description: Name of lab or department within the institute where the individual works.
laboratory.example: Division of Vaccine Discovery; Department of Biology

address.description: Street address where the individual works.
address.guidelines: Include street name and number, city, country division, and postal code.

corresponding_contributor.description: Whether the individual is a primary point of contact for the project.
corresponding_contributor.example: Should be one of: yes, or no.

project_role.description: Primary role of the individual in the project.

orcid_id.description: The individual's ORCID ID linked to previous work.

supplementary_links.description: External link(s) pointing to code, supplementary data files, or analysis files associated with the project which will not be uploaded.

items.description: Information about a journal article, book, web page, or other external available documentation for a project.
items.title: Publication
items.name: publication

authors.description: A list of authors associated with the publication.
authors.guidelines: List each author in 'surname initials' format.

publication_title.example: Study of single cells in the human body.

doi.description: The publication digital object identifier (doi) of the publication.

pmid.description: The PubMed ID of the publication.

insdc_project.description: An International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration (INSDC) project accession.
insdc_project.guidelines: Enter accession if project has been archived. Accession can be from the DDBJ, NCBI, or EMBL-EBI and must start with DRP, SRP, or ERP, respectively.

geo_series.description: A Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO) series accession.
geo_series.guidelines: Enter accession if project has been archived. Accession must start with GSE.

array_express_investigation.guidelines: Enter accession if project has been archived. Accession must start with E-.

insdc_study.description: An International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration (INSDC) study accession.
insdc_study.guidelines: Enter accession if study has been archived. Accession can be from the DDBJ, NCBI, or EMBL-EBI and must start with PRJD, PRJN, or PRJE, respectively.

items.description: Information about the project funding source.
items.title: Funder
items.name: funder

grant_title.description: The name of the grant funding the project.
grant_title.example: Study of single cells in the human body.
grant_title.guidelines: Enter a title of approximately 30 words.

grant_id.description: The unique grant identifier or reference.

funder_name.description: The name of the funding organization.
funder_name.example: Biotechnology and Biological Sciences Research Council (BBSRC); California Institute of Regenerative Medicine (CIRM)
